article_text:
Hartz Strikes Syms Deal; Sale Needs Court Approval

More than two years after discount retailer Syms Corp. filed for bankruptcy, its former headquarters and store in Secaucus, N.J. is set to be sold to New Jersey real estate giant Hartz Mountain Industries Inc., according to several people familiar with the deal.

Syms successor Trinity Place Holdings Inc. and Hartz presented a plan late last week in U.S. bankruptcy court in Delaware. The deal, which needs court approval, calls for Trinity Place Holdings to sell its...
